node.title: 'I'm not spooked:' Experts weigh in on sharemarket's recent downturn
node.description: The New Zealand share market is down nearly 8 percent and bitcoin has shrunk nearly 20 percent.
node.content: ["Investing was the big success story of our first lockdown.", "Whatever happened with Covid-19 world share markets and even cryptocurrencies kept on rising and many of us invested through platforms like sharesies and hatc", "But over the past couple of weeks that's no longer the case.", "For 13 years world share markets have mostly charged ahead, but this month's downturn could be the end of the longest bull market in history.", "It is enough to spook investors into pulling out.", "\"I did briefly consider it actually the other morning when I woke up and looked at the movement overnight and thought, shall I get out before it does go any lower?\" Investor Andrew Wall said.", "For two years now 21-year-old Wall has thrown his spare cash at US shares through platforms like Sharesies, Hatch, Stake and Tiger.\u00a0", "In two weeks, a $15,000 nest egg has shrunk by about 10 percent, but he's hanging in.", "\"It could go on for quite a long time, but you know I just have faith looking back at history that it will rebound and I'm sure it will and I think the worse response for me now will be to panic sell and potentially lose all my money,\" he says.", "Likewise Anita Hayhoe who works in finance but invests for fun.", "\"I'm not spooked,\" she says.", "That's despite inflation hitting 5.9 percent and news interest rates here and in the US are almost certain to rise.", "Over the past month the US share market has shrunk 10 percent, our share market is down nearly 8 percent and bitcoin has shrunk nearly 20 percent.\u00a0", "\"I think that people who panic and sell out they're putting themselves at more risk of losing money than if they hold on and just see what happens,\" Hayhoe says.", "Sharesies saw a surge in investors during the first lockdown, but co-founder Sonya Williams says few are quitting.", "\"We did see and we do when this news comes out a small change in behaviour but really nothing going on so I think that is really heartening to see because it means that people are investing for the long term, it's not money that they're needing right now,\" Williams says.", "Mary Holm's written books on investing and in particular on Kiwisaver, which has also slipped.", "\"The markets are a bit wobbly again and we don't know what's going to happen, but in the long run they always have gone up and they always will go up,\" Holm says.", "Holm's advice is to ignore the wobbles or if you're in it for the short term, don't buy shares, go for the lower risk of bonds or bank term deposits."]
